</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Searches for an element within array for which the code evaluates to true.
Returns the zero-based index on success or -1 if not found.
Code on the right side of the command is evaluated for each element of the array, processed element can be referenced in code as [[_x]].

<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[findIf]] terminates as soon as it finds an element that fulfills the condition, thus it is more efficient than [[count]] in scenarios where you need to check for presence / absence of at least one element that evaluates to true.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> array [[findIf]] code </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> array: [[Array]] - array to search in </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> code: [[Code]] - code defining an element to find, processed element can be referenced within the code as [[_x]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - Zero-based position of the first array element for which the code evaluate to true, -1 if not found </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[unit1, unit2, unit3] [[findIf]] {[[not]] [[alive]] [[_x]]}; <template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// return index of the first dead unit)</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code><template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// two ways how to 'wait for all units to be dead':</value></part></template>
[[waitUntil]] { [unit1, unit2, unit3] [[findIf]] {[[alive]] [[_x]]} == -1 }; <template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// fast, terminates as soon as it finds a living unit</value></part></template>
[[waitUntil]] { {[[alive]] [[_x]]} [[count]] [unit1, unit2, unit3] == 0 }; <template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// slow, always goes through all array elements</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>Example 2</name>=<value>
